section.title: Main window
section.para: The main window is the only Gwyddion part that appears after start with no parameters. It consist of set of Gwyddion menus: File, Edit, Data Process, Graph and Meta, and from several rows of buttons connected with tools and modules (accessible also by menus).
File menu associates commands that are used for file input and output. Global commands (e. g. Exit) are located here too. Submenu command names are self-explanatory (Load, Save, etc.).

Edit menu constist of commands that are applicable on more data windows (e. g. Data arithmetic) and commands that change status of data window presentation or selection. Masks and presentations options can be also set here.

Data process menu is build automatically from all the modules available at the Gwyddion modules directory (depending on operating system). Modules are responsible for all the data processing, so this menu item associates most of the commands you will need at analyzing your SPM data.
Graph menu consist of commands that are applicable on graphs. Graph processing includes reading values of graphs, measuring profile distances etc.
Meta are commands that provide information about height field metadata (e. g. scanning speed, tip voltage, etc.) and information about the Gwyddion (About).
Finally, you can find some rows of buttons in the main window. These buttons represent tools and some of the modules.
